title: `const_item_mutation` has false positives with `&mut &T`

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
    pub const SERVER_CERT: &[u8] = include_bytes!("./ca/server.pem");
    let certs = rustls_pemfile::certs(&mut SERVER_CERT).unwrap();
```

I expected to see this happen: No warning, because it's not actually possible for `SERVER_CERT` to be mutated, even if it weren't a constant.

Instead, this happened:
```
warning: taking a mutable reference to a `const` item
  --> src/lib.rs:42:39
   |
42 |     let certs = rustls_pemfile::certs(&mut SERVER_CERT).unwrap();
   |                                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(const_item_mutation)]` on by default
   = note: each usage of a `const` item creates a new temporary
   = note: the mutable reference will refer to this temporary, not the original `const` item
note: `const` item defined here
  --> src/lib.rs:11:1
   |
11 | pub const SERVER_CERT: &[u8] = include_bytes!("../ca/server.pem");
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```
